cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north tonight then accelerating north-northeast, expected to cross the northern Gulf Coast Wednesday night and sweep inland across the Southeast before reaching the Mid-Atlantic coast and moving offshore near New Jersey by early Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast (between Morgan City, LA and the MS/AL border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, LA (Gulf Coast – not near NY/NJ)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning Morgan City, LA to MS/AL border; Tropical-storm warning MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton Co. line, FL; Storm-surge warning Mouth of Atchafalaya River, LA to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast, then inland across MS, AL, GA, Carolinas, VA, NJ and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈9%) of tropical-storm-force gusts, mainly Friday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge possible (<3 ft) during high-tide cycles Friday
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher totals could cause urban and small-stream flooding Friday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief marine swell/rough seas and reduced visibilities; isolated tornado threat remains well south of the port
